New Records: Adolis García set a record for RBIs in a postseason series with 15.
Bruce Bochy became the first skipper to win a League Championship Series with three different teams.
The Texas Rangers joined the 1996 Yankees as the only teams to win their first eight road games in one postseason.
Adolis García's home run streak is tied for fourth-longest in postseason history.
Key Match Events: Adolis García homered twice and drove in five runs.
Corey Seager hit a long home run in the first inning.
Nathaniel Lowe also hit a home run.
Cristian Javier recorded just one out before getting pulled in the first inning.
Jordan Montgomery pitched 2 1/3 scoreless innings for the win.
Max Scherzer allowed four hits and two runs in 2 2/3 innings.
Alex Bregman hit a solo homer in the third inning.
Evan Carter hit a two-run double in the fourth inning.
Adolis García hit a two-run single in the fourth inning.
Adolis García hit a solo home run in the eighth inning.
Jose Altuve hit his 27th career postseason homer in the ninth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Bruce Bochy reflected on his return to managing and the team's journey.
Dusty Baker acknowledged the Astros' successful recent history despite the loss.
Adolis García expressed pride in his team's unity and effort.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rangers secured their first World Series berth in 12 years.
The road team won every game in the series.
The Astros were dethroned as defending World Series champions.
The Texas Rangers and Houston Astros had identical regular-season records (90-72).
Texas' win guaranteed a third all-wild card World Series.
